questions.question_text:
FILL BLANK -
Fill in the blanks to complete the statement.
When creating multiple containers, in order to allow communication with each other, you must create a __________ of type _________ .

discussion.content:
The question is very large.
In which context is it ? Docker ? On the same host? On multiple hosts? On Kubernetes ?
 
If this is docker-focused, I would say "network" for the first blank but for the type, it depends... On the same host, I would say "bridge", on multiple hosts, "overlay"...

https://docs.docker.com/network/

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What is the reason for this error message?

discussion.content: As I think, "C" is the answer.

choices.D: The site-packages directory has been corrupted.
choices.B: The requests module is not installed.
choices.C: The required dependencies for the requests module are not installed.
choices.A: The required dependencies for the urllib3 module are not installed.

choices.B: Use dedicated hardware for all instances.
choices.A: Monitor data transfers to minimize cost.
choices.D: Make use of elastic services and scale on demand.
choices.C: Select the largest instance option available in order to pay for only one instance.

questions.question_text: What is the effective way to manage computing costs in a public cloud?

comments.content:
I go for "B"
Sorry for typo

discussion.content:
I go for "A"

Tried creating the ConfigMap and Pod on Kubernetes. Pod and Volume were not created with the error below:

root@controlplane:~# k describe pod configmap-demo-pod
(snip)
Events:
 Type Reason Age From Message
 ---- ------ ---- ---- -------
 Normal Scheduled 57s default-scheduler Successfully assigned default/configmap-demo-pod to controlplane
 Warning FailedMount 25s (x7 over 57s) kubelet MountVolume.SetUp failed for volume "config" : configmap references non-existent config key: different.filename
root@controlplane:~#

choices.D: The volume is created with errors.
choices.A: The default path is not used.

questions.question_text: ConfigMap keys have been mapped to different file names using the volumes.configMap.items field. What is the result if a wrong ConfigMap key is specified?
What are two benefits of Infrastructure as Code? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
Most risk these days is caused by human error. There have been multiple major outages caused by a single command-line argument being input incorrectly (S3, Unisuper/GCP, OVH, Meta, etc).

So while I see what you are saying (automation can expand the scope of an error), automation really does reduce risk.

discussion.content:
I do not agree that it reduces risk. If anything, it increases it.
It takes a human to disrupt a service, it takes automation to disrupt all of them
